title: 'Trump is torn between the UAE and Saudi Arabia'
subhead: US President Donald Trump faces pressure from Mohammed bin Salman to oppose the separatist strategy pursued by the United Arab Emirates in Sudan, and even more so in Yemen, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu, a professor at Sciences Po Paris.

subhead: Defending champion Paris Saint-Germain  beat Paris FC on Sunday, in the first top-level derby since 1990.

title: For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
subhead: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: The kingdom of the 'shamassa,' Sudan's children of war
subhead: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (4/6) 'Shamassa' means 'child of the sun,' but these street children wear the name poorly. Turned into easy prey by the conflict, the orphans live at the mercy of armed groups, telling the story of war through a child's eyes.

title: At the Louvre, tension builds over creation of new 'Mona Lisa' gallery
subhead: The Louvre-Nouvelle Renaissance architecture competition aims to create a room for Leonardo da Vinci's iconic painting and a new entrance for the Paris museum, which has seen a surge in visitors. Five teams have been shortlisted, none of which are French.
